verses.text: 以認識基督為至寶最後，我的弟兄們，你們要靠著主喜樂。我寫這些話給你們，在我並不困難，對你們卻是妥當的。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts for things of supreme spiritual value.
Refers to fellow believers in a Christian context.
Often used to intensify a negative statement.

verses.text: 你們要提防那些「狗」，提防作惡的，提防行割禮的。

words.note: Used metaphorically as a derogatory term for opponents.
Turns the preceding verb phrase 'do evil' into 'evildoers'.
A verb-object compound: to perform a rite of circumcision.
Turns the preceding verb phrase 'practice circumcision' into 'circumcisers'.

verses.text: 其實我們這些靠　神的靈來敬拜，在基督耶穌裡誇口而不倚靠肉體的人，才是受割禮的，

words.note: The preceding space is a traditional reverence marker for 'God' in Chinese Bibles.
In this context, referring to the Holy Spirit.
In a spiritual sense, referring to human nature or carnal desires.
Turns the preceding phrase into a descriptive noun.
A verb-object compound: to receive the rite of circumcision.
Turns the preceding verb phrase into 'the circumcised'.

verses.text: 雖然我有理由可以倚靠肉體。如果別人認為可以倚靠肉體，我就更加可以了；
我第八天受割禮，屬於以色列民族便雅憫支派，是希伯來人所生的希伯來人。按著律法來說，我是個法利賽人；

words.note: Common phrasing for 'to be circumcised'.
Refers to the Hebrew people.
Indicates the agent or acts as a nominalizer, often for passive voice.
Often refers to the Mosaic Law in a biblical context.
A member of an ancient Jewish sect known for strict adherence to oral and written law.

verses.text: 按著熱誠來說，我是迫害教會的；按著律法上的義來說，我是無可指摘的。

words.note: Lit. 'cannot be criticized'.

verses.text: 然而以前對我有益的，現在因著基督的緣故，我都當作是有損的。

words.definition: to regard as, to consider as

verses.text: 不但這樣，我也把萬事當作是有損的，因為我以認識我主基督耶穌為至寶。為了他，我把萬事都拋棄了，看作廢物，為了要得著基督。

words.note: Introduces direct object before verb.
Often used in religious context meaning 'all worldly things'.

words.definition: to regard as, to consider as

words.note: Part of the structure '以...為' (to regard...as).
Part of the structure '以...為' (to regard...as).

words.definition: for the sake of, in order to

words.note: Introduces direct object before verb.
Often used in religious context meaning 'all worldly things'.

words.definition: to regard as, to consider as
for the sake of, in order to

verses.text: 並且得以在他裡面，不是有自己因律法而得的義，而是有因信基督而得的義，就是基於信心，從　神而來的義，

words.definition: to be able to, to succeed in

words.note: Connects cause/manner (因) to result/action (得).
Connects cause/manner (因) to result/action (得).

verses.text: 使我認識基督和他復活的大能，並且在他所受的苦上有分，受他所受的死；

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with following verb: 'what is V-ed by'.

words.definition: to have a share in, participate

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with following verb: 'what is V-ed by'.

verses.text: 這樣，我也許可以從死人中復活。

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

verses.text: 向著目標竭力追求這並不是說我已經得著了，已經完全了，而是竭力追求，好使我可以得著基督耶穌所以得著我的（「所以得著我的」或譯「要我得著的」）。

words.note: A resultative verb, 'to successfully obtain'.

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: A resultative verb, 'to successfully obtain'.

words.definition: that by which, the reason for which
words.note: In this context, functions as a relative pronoun for purpose/reason.
A resultative verb, 'to successfully obtain'.

words.definition: that by which, the reason for which
words.note: In this context, functions as a relative pronoun for purpose/reason.
A resultative verb, 'to successfully obtain'.

words.definition: to want, to be about to

words.note: A resultative verb, 'to successfully obtain'.

verses.text: 弟兄們，我不以為自己已經得著了，我只有一件事，就是忘記背後，努力前面的事，

words.definition: do not consider, do not think

breakdown.m: to take as, by means of

words.note: A resultative verb, 'to successfully obtain'.

verses.text: 向著目標竭力追求，為要得著　神在基督耶穌裡召我往上去得的獎賞。

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

words.note: A resultative verb, 'to successfully obtain'.
The leading space is a traditional mark of reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 所以，我們中間凡是成熟的人，都應當這樣思想。即使你們不是這樣思想，　神也會把這事指示你們。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional mark of reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 不過，我們到了甚麼程度，就要照著甚麼程度去行。

words.note: Lit. 'not exceed', hence 'however'.
Indicates completion or a new situation.
Often used in 'if...then' or 'as soon as...then' constructions.
Often indicates performing an action away from the speaker.

verses.text: 切望救主再臨弟兄們，你們要一同效法我，也要留意那些照著我們的榜樣而行的人。

words.note: Refers to Jesus Christ.
Refers to the second coming of Christ.
Used as a collective term for male believers.
Connects clauses, often indicating a consequence or continuation.
Forms a noun phrase from a preceding verb or adjective.

verses.text: 我常常告訴你們，現在又流著淚說，有許多人行事為人，是基督十字架的仇敵，

words.note: Indicates repetition or an additional action.
The particle '著' indicates a continuous or sustained state.
Literally 'act matters, be human'.
Transliteration of 'Christ'.
Lit. 'ten-character frame', referring to the shape of a cross.

verses.text: 他們的結局是滅亡，他們的神是自己的肚腹，他們以自己的羞辱為榮耀，所思想的都是地上的事。

words.note: Often refers to spiritual or eternal destruction.
Can refer to pagan gods or the one true God.
Figuratively, desires or appetites.
Often used in the structure '以 A 為 B' (take A as B).
Used in the structure '以 A 為 B' (take A as B).
Precedes a verb to indicate the object of the action, often translating as 'that which'.
Forms a noun phrase from a preceding verb or adjective.

verses.text: 但我們是天上的公民，切望救主，就是主耶穌基督，從天上降臨；

words.note: Refers to Jesus Christ.
Emphasizes that something is exactly as stated.
A title for God or Jesus.

verses.text: 他要運用那使萬有歸服自己的大能，改變我們這卑賤的身體，和他榮耀的身體相似。

words.note: Indicates future tense or intention.
Functions here as a demonstrative pronoun, referring to 'the power'.
Connects an attributive to the noun it modifies.
Functions here as a demonstrative pronoun, referring to 'our body'.
Connects an attributive (卑賤) to the noun (身體) it modifies.
Refers to Christ.
Connects an attributive (榮耀) to the noun (身體) it modifies.
